title: Firefox wont even launch immediately crashes every time
content: I downloaded Firefox a while ago and it would work and just a few hours ago I had completely restored my pc to see if it improves issues I had and speed, but the same issues I was having with Firefox are still happening. When first downloaded it runs for maybe 2 seconds then crashes and if you try to re open it, you either cant or see it pop up in the task bar only to go away the next second like a flicker. I've deleted and redownloaded it already and I cant find the crash report on my pc even from the Win + R so I was wondering if anybody ever had an issue like this and how they fixed it.
creator: killerbeanfan69

title: toggle tracking protection, and not being able to view full web pages
content:
hello there!

i have had this persistent issue: when a site seems broken, i used to be able to try turning off Enhanced Tracking Protection, by 

   Clicking on the shield Icon to the left of the address bar, then    Toggling the switch at the top of the panel.

But for the past week or two, the toggle button stays on and i canno toggle it off.

Also, a related issue, ie.the reason ive mos recently tried to do this, is so i can view the whole yelp review web pages. I used to be able to, but fo the pas few weeks a large portion of these pages hav blanks instead of reviews. I cannot even view the review i myself posted a week ago!

For example, this yelp business page link text

if you scroll down to beneath of where it says:

'''Ask the Community Ask a question Yelp users haven’t asked any questions yet about Precision Dentistry.'''

there should be text and photos of companies' reviews and info. But instead, all i ever see are grayed out empty boxes.

I have tried: 

disabling all my add-ons,

private browing mode, 

restarting firefox,

turning of all tracking protection from the main firefox preferences pane, rebooting my computer, and clearing all history for everything. I have also googled this up the yinyang but no one else seems to be having similar issues.

Any ideas? if you could please help with this issue i'd be very grateful!
creator: coatli

title: User/passwords deleted
content: So, long story short.... Had a power outage and now my users/passwords won't appear on sites or firefox configuration.
creator: gabval999

title: Losing scrollbar arrows after every upgrade
content: I lost my arrows on my scrollbar again after an update early last month. I tried adding lines to the gtk.css config files with no success unlike I've been successful doing in the past. It appears they are gone forever unless I can find another way to get them back. I noticed that the scrollbar arrows are gone on only Firefox and Thunderbird. As mentioned, this has happened in the past after some updates but in the past I was able to edit the gtk.css files in both gtk-2.0 and gtk-3.0 to get them back. Is there anything else I can try. I'm using the latest version of Ubuntu (Pop OS to be specific) and the arrows to the scrollbars disappeared around April 2nd for both Firefox and Thunderbird. I didn't notice any other applications where the arrows to the scrollbars disappeared. Is there something else I can try and a way to prevent this from happening in the future. This seems to be a common problem that happens every time there is an update.
creator: mtonkinson

title: Is there a fix for significant energy drain on M1 mac, Monterey 12.3.1 and Firefox 99.0.1?
content: I'm not sure why my battery is suddenly draining so fast. Looks like everything's up to date and I have to keep manually force quit on Activity Monitor. Is there a solution to fix this issue?

title: Missing a suspicious Extension in the Manager?
content: I'm highly suspicious of an extensions i downloaded a while ago. It has blocked facebook from tracking me as some websites i access automatically uses Facebook. When I checked the manager to make an exception for a website I was using, I don't see it there, not even to disable it. I even double checked if my only blocker, UBlock Origin is preventing it from showing but it's not even there either. So now I'm worried my data is compromised.
creator: rdsreloaded

title: Linha preta debaixo da barra de pesquisa
content: Baixei o firefox mais cedo, já terminei de trazer tudo do meu navegador antigo pro mesmo, e só sobrou uma coisa que ainda me incomoda, essa linha preta (na imagem). fiquei um bom tempo pesquisando em threads gringas muito antigas no reddit e perguntas no proprio site de suporte mozilla, mas não consegui achar uma solução. tentei mudar varias opcoes no about:config, ate criei um userChrome.css e tentei sumir com a linha usando muitos, muitos codigos diferentes (tinha uma nocao bem superficial de css, nao consegui fazer muita coisa). so desisti e to vindo pedir ajuda aqui mesmo, por mais que seja uma coisa trivial, o tanto que essa linha me incomoda é algo surreal
creator: jowvxx
